is a warm and welcoming town located on the shores of Lough Erne in

. It is probably most well known as being the home of Belleek Pottery where the world famous parian china with the same trademark name is made. However, the area boasts wonderful natural beauty and is popular with tourists from all over the world, many of whom travel to fish the local lakes in the area.

Belleek is one of the ports of call on the Erne-Shannon waterway.
